chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Your Response:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

Your Response:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
None

Goal:
forall a b d : Z, is_gcdZ a b d -> is_gcd Z IdZ Z.mul 0%Z a b d

Premises:
Inductive Z : Set := Z0 : Z | Zpos : positive -> Z | Zneg : positive -> Z Arguments Zpos _%positive_scope Arguments Zneg _%positive_scope
is_gcd : forall S : Set, (S -> Prop) -> (S -> S -> S) -> S -> S -> S -> S -> Prop
N.mul = fun n m : N => match n with | 0%N => 0%N | N.pos p => match m with | 0%N => 0%N | N.pos q => N.pos (p * q) end end : N -> N -> N Arguments N.mul (_ _)%N_scope
Inductive is_gcdZ : Z -> Z -> Z -> Prop := gcd_OZ : forall b : Z, is_gcdZ 0 b (Z.abs b) | gcd_mod : forall b a d q r : Z, b <> 0%Z -> (0 <= r < Z.abs b)%Z -> a = (b * q + r)%Z -> is_gcdZ r b d -> is_gcdZ b a d Arguments is_gcdZ (_ _ _)%Z_scope Arguments gcd_OZ _%Z_scope Arguments gcd_mod (_ _ _ _ _)%Z_scope
IdZ = fun _ : Z => True : Z -> Prop Arguments IdZ _%Z_scope
gcd_unicity_apart_sign : forall a b c d : Z, is_gcd Z IdZ Z.mul 0%Z a b c -> is_gcd Z IdZ Z.mul 0%Z a b d -> d = c \/ d = (- c)%Z
gcd_mod : forall b a d q r : Z, b <> 0%Z -> (0 <= r < Z.abs b)%Z -> a = (b * q + r)%Z -> is_gcdZ r b d -> is_gcdZ b a d
is_gcdZ_sind : forall P : Z -> Z -> Z -> SProp, (forall b : Z, P 0%Z b (Z.abs b)) -> (forall b a d q r : Z, b <> 0%Z -> (0 <= r < Z.abs b)%Z -> a = (b * q + r)%Z -> is_gcdZ r b d -> P r b d -> P b a d) -> forall z z0 z1 : Z, is_gcdZ z z0 z1 -> P z z0 z1
is_gcdZ_ind : forall P : Z -> Z -> Z -> Prop, (forall b : Z, P 0%Z b (Z.abs b)) -> (forall b a d q r : Z, b <> 0%Z -> (0 <= r < Z.abs b)%Z -> a = (b * q + r)%Z -> is_gcdZ r b d -> P r b d -> P b a d) -> forall z z0 z1 : Z, is_gcdZ z z0 z1 -> P z z0 z1
gcd_OZ_absZ : forall b : Z, is_gcd Z IdZ Z.mul 0%Z 0%Z b (Z.abs b)
gcdZ_i : forall a b x : Z, is_gcdZ a b x -> {x : Z | is_gcdZ a b x}
Z.quot_mul : forall a b : Z, b <> 0%Z -> (a * b ÷ b)%Z = a
Z.div_mul : forall a b : Z, b <> 0%Z -> (a * b / b)%Z = a
have_gcdZ = fun a b : Z => {d : Z | is_gcdZ a b d} : Z -> Z -> Set Arguments have_gcdZ (_ _)%Z_scope
Z.rem_eq : forall a b : Z, b <> 0%Z -> Z.rem a b = (a - b * (a ÷ b))%Z
gcd_null2 : forall (S : Set) (A : S -> Prop) (Add Mult : S -> S -> S) (O : S) (Opp : S -> S), is_ring S A Add Mult O Opp -> forall d : S, is_gcd S A Mult O O O d -> d = O
Z.div_eucl_eq : forall a b : Z, b <> 0%Z -> let (q, r) := Z.div_eucl a b in a = (b * q + r)%Z
gcd_null : forall (S : Set) (A : S -> Prop) (Mult : S -> S -> S) (O a b : S), is_gcd S A Mult O a b O -> a = O /\ b = O
Z.rem_mul : forall a b : Z, b <> 0%Z -> Z.rem (a * b) b = 0%Z
Z.quot_opp_l : forall a b : Z, b <> 0%Z -> (- a ÷ b)%Z = (- (a ÷ b))%Z
Zmod_divides : forall a b : Z, b <> 0%Z -> (a mod b)%Z = 0%Z < -> (exists c : Z, a = (b * c)%Z)
Z.mod_mul : forall a b : Z, b <> 0%Z -> ((a * b) mod b)%Z = 0%Z
Z.mod_pos_bound : forall a b : Z, (0 < b)%Z -> (0 <= a mod b < b)%Z
Z.mod_divide : forall a b : Z, b <> 0%Z -> (a mod b)%Z = 0%Z < -> (b | a)%Z
Z.mod_eq : forall a b : Z, b <> 0%Z -> (a mod b)%Z = (a - b * (a / b))%Z
Z.mul_quot_ge : forall a b : Z, (a <= 0)%Z -> b <> 0%Z -> (a <= b * (a ÷ b) <= 0)%Z
Z.mul_quot_le : forall a b : Z, (0 <= a)%Z -> b <> 0%Z -> (0 <= b * (a ÷ b) <= a)%Z
Zdiv_eucl_extended : forall b : Z, b <> 0%Z -> forall a : Z, {qr : Z * Z | let (q, r) := qr in a = (b * q + r)%Z /\ (0 <= r < Z.abs b)%Z}
BinIntDef.Z.modulo = fun a b : Z => let (_, r) := BinIntDef.Z.div_eucl a b in r : Z -> Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.modulo (_ _)%Z_scope
BinIntDef.Z.div = fun a b : Z => let (q, _) := BinIntDef.Z.div_eucl a b in q : Z -> Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.div (_ _)%Z_scope
Z_div_mod : forall a b : Z, (b > 0)%Z -> let (q, r) := Z.div_eucl a b in a = (b * q + r)%Z /\ (0 <= r < b)%Z
Z_div_mod_POS : forall b : Z, (b > 0)%Z -> forall a : positive, let (q, r) := Z.pos_div_eucl a b in Z.pos a = (b * q + r)%Z /\ (0 <= r < b)%Z
gcd_unicity_apart_unities : forall (S : Set) (A : S -> Prop) (Add Mult : S -> S -> S) (O I : S) (Opp : S -> S), is_unitary_commutative_ring S A Add Mult O I Opp -> integrity S Mult O -> forall a b d1 d2 : S, is_gcd S A Mult O a b d1 -> is_gcd S A Mult O a b d2 -> exists x : S, inversible S Mult I x /\ A x /\ d2 = Mult d1 x
gcd_OZ : forall b : Z, is_gcdZ 0 b (Z.abs b)
BinIntDef.Z.quot = fun a b : Z => fst (BinIntDef.Z.quotrem a b) : Z -> Z -> Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.quot (_ _)%Z_scope

```coq
intros a b d H.
apply is_gcdZ_sind with (P := fun z z0 z1 => is_gcd Z IdZ Z.mul 0%Z z z0 z1).
- apply gcd_OZ.
- intros b a d q r H1 H2 H3 H4.
  rewrite H3.
  apply H4.
Qed.

original: intros a b d H. apply is_gcdZ_sind with (P := fun z z0 z1 => is_gcd Z IdZ Z.mul 0%Z z z0 z1). - apply gcd_OZ. - intros b a d q r H1 H2 H3 H4. rewrite H3. apply H4.
